title: Fanny Blankers-Koen
summary: Francina "Fanny" Elsje Blankers-Koen (26 April 1918 â€“ 25 January 2004) was a Dutch track and field athlete, best known for winning four gold medals at the 1948 Summer Olympics in London. She competed there as a 30-year-old mother of two, earning her the nickname "the flying housewife", and was the most successful athlete at the event.
